flow.context: Erin Tsu is COO and co-owner of Helios Vacation Rentals — 32 luxury short-term rentals across Greater Palm Springs, San Diego, and Temecula. She runs daily operations over an in-house cleaning team, an Inspections Manager (Rosana Castro), and an Operations Manager (Marcela De Dios). Helios uses Hostaway for PMS, Safely.com for damage waivers (only $1,500 coverage), noise sensors, and smart home automation — but no detectable photo/inspection platform like Breezeway. Sam connection: both are SoCal natives from the LA area — Erin's 626 area code is San Gabriel Valley, Sam grew up in La Cañada Flintridge right next door.

opener.label: OPENER
opener.say: Hey Erin — I work with a few vacation rental operators out in the Palm Springs area, and I'm actually from LA myself. It's Sam Parks with RapidEye. Have you heard my name tossed around at all?
opener.note: Feet-on-the-desk energy. Relaxed, not rushed. Sound like you're calling someone who should know you. If someone else answers, jump to gatekeeper.

heard_yes.label: THEY'VE HEARD OF YOU
heard_yes.say: Oh nice — well normally we'd be working with someone like you. What did you hear?
heard_yes.note: Rare but great. Let her talk. Mirror whatever she says and steer toward inspection pain.

heard_no.label: HAVEN'T HEARD — TRANSITION
heard_no.say: Ha — guess I'm not as popular as I thought. Well the reason for my call is —
heard_no.note: Deliver with a chuckle, then flow straight into pain_trigger. Don't pause here — keep the momentum going.

bad_timing.label: BAD TIMING
bad_timing.say: Totally hear you — would it be a terrible idea if I tried you again later this week? Or is there a better day that works?
bad_timing.note: Don't push. Lock in a specific callback time if possible.

reschedule_callback.label: CALLBACK LOCKED
reschedule_callback.say: Perfect — I'll try you then. Really appreciate it, Erin. Talk soon.
reschedule_callback.note: Write down the exact day and time. When you call back open with: 'Hey Erin, Sam Parks — we talked the other day, you told me to try you back.'

permission_fallback.label: PERMISSION ASK
permission_fallback.say: Yeah totally — I mean it is a cold call. Can I get thirty seconds to tell you why I reached out? And you can totally hang up on me if it's not a fit.
permission_fallback.note: Safety net. Most people give you 30 seconds when you acknowledge the cold call and hand them an exit.

permission_rejected.label: PERMISSION REJECTED
permission_rejected.say: Totally my bad, Erin. Just so nobody from my team bugs you again — is it that I caught you at a horrible time, or is it that you already know what we do and this just isn't interesting?
permission_rejected.note: Split the rejection. Most people will clarify — and clarification reopens the conversation.

pain_trigger.label: PAIN TRIGGER
pain_trigger.say: Yeah so — I was talking to another luxury rental operator out in the valley, pretty similar setup to you guys. About thirty properties, in-house cleaning team, really pride themselves on quality. And they were telling me that even with a solid inspection process, stuff slips through — especially during festival season when you're flipping houses back to back. Guest checks out Sunday morning, cleaners come through by noon, new guest arrives at four — and somewhere in there a cracked patio table or a missing set of towels just doesn't get caught. Two turnovers later someone notices, and now it's a he-said-she-said with the damage waiver. And with something like Safely only covering fifteen hundred bucks on a luxury property — that doesn't go far.
pain_trigger.note: PAUSE after this. Let it breathe. You just described Erin's exact world — 32 luxury properties, in-house cleaning, Safely.com, Coachella and Stagecoach season. Let her react before you say another word.

branches.label: Yeah / that resonates / shares her own pain
We've got that handled / have a process
What do you do about it? / What's RapidEye?

solution_bridge.label: ONE-SENTENCE SOLUTION
solution_bridge.say: We built something that plugs into the turnover photos your team's already taking — AI compares each set against a baseline and flags damage, missing items, staging issues automatically. Hooks right into Hostaway, no workflow change on your end.
solution_bridge.note: One breath. Then CTA. You mentioned Hostaway — their actual PMS — which shows you did homework. Don't keep selling.

branches.label: We already have something for that

warm_response.label: THEY'RE WARM — STOP PITCHING
warm_response.say: That's actually why I wanted to reach you specifically — I know you're running ops across thirty-plus properties with your own cleaning crew. What does your inspection process look like right now after turnovers?
warm_response.note: STOP SELLING. Start asking. You're in discovery mode now. Let Erin talk about her world. Mirror and validate whatever she shares.

branches.label: Asks about RapidEye / wants more details

discovery_process.label: DISCOVERY — PROCESS
discovery_process.say: Got it. And when your team's going through those photos — is that something someone's manually reviewing every set, or is it more of a spot-check situation?
discovery_process.note: You're looking for the gap. Most teams either don't review photos at all or one person is overwhelmed doing it. Either answer leads to RapidEye's value.

branches.label: Manual review / one person checks them

discovery_team.label: DISCOVERY — TEAM
discovery_team.say: Oh nice — so Rosana's running inspections? That's solid. Is she reviewing all the photos herself, or does she have help with that?
discovery_team.note: You know Rosana Castro is their Inspections Manager. Dropping her name shows depth. Say it casually — like you've heard the name before, not like you're reading a dossier.

branches.label: Yes, Rosana handles it / small team

discovery_festival.label: DISCOVERY — FESTIVAL SEASON
discovery_festival.say: Yeah, Coachella and Stagecoach weeks must be insane for you guys. How many turnovers are you doing back to back during that stretch?
discovery_festival.note: Festival season is when damage risk peaks and inspection quality drops. This is the highest-pain moment for any Palm Springs operator. Let her vent.

branches.label: We handle it well / have it dialed

discovery_deeper.label: DISCOVERY — DIG DEEPER
discovery_deeper.say: Makes sense. And when something does get missed — a scuff on the wall, a broken piece of furniture — how does that usually play out? Does Safely cover most of it, or are you guys eating some of those costs?
discovery_deeper.note: Money question. Safely.com caps at $1,500 for unintentional damage. On luxury properties real damage often exceeds that. Let her tell you about the gap.

branches.label: We eat costs / Safely doesn't cover enough
It's not a huge problem for us
That's more Pablo's area / operations handles it

discovery_tools.label: DISCOVERY — CURRENT TOOLS
discovery_tools.say: Oh interesting — what are you guys using for that?
discovery_tools.note: Research shows no inspection platform detected at Helios. If she names something, take notes. If it's manual, checklists, or spreadsheets, that's your opening.

cta_meeting.label: CTA — ASK FOR THE MEETING
cta_meeting.say: Here's what I'm thinking — would you be open to taking a look at what this actually does? Not a big production, just fifteen minutes. I can show you what it catches on real turnover photos. If nothing else, I'll walk you through what other PM companies in the valley are doing with their inspection workflows — worst case you steal some ideas and we part as friends.
cta_meeting.note: Low friction. Position it as valuable even if she never buys. 'Steal some ideas' removes all commitment pressure.

branches.label: I'd need to loop in Pablo / my partner

cta_meeting_soft.label: CTA — SOFT ASK
cta_meeting_soft.say: Totally get it — sounds like you guys run a tight ship, which makes sense given how you built Helios. Would you be open to a quick look anyway? Even just to see what's coming down the pike with AI and inspections — a lot of operators your size are starting to look at this heading into peak season.
cta_meeting_soft.note: She said it's not a huge problem. Don't fight it. Appeal to forward-thinking and staying ahead of competitors. Reference that Helios was literally founded on quality standards.

book_meeting.label: BOOK THE MEETING
book_meeting.say: Awesome. I've got next week pulled up — how does Tuesday or Wednesday look? I can do morning or afternoon, whatever's easier for you.
book_meeting.note: Give two day options. Lock a specific day AND time. Send the calendar invite while still on the phone if possible.

branches.label: Let me check and get back to you

meeting_booked.label: MEETING CONFIRMED
meeting_booked.say: Perfect — I'll send over a calendar invite right now so it's locked in. Really appreciate you taking my call, Erin. Talk to you then.
meeting_booked.note: STOP SELLING. Send the invite immediately. Don't add anything else. Don't re-pitch. End on a high note and get off the phone.

objection_not_interested.label: OBJECTION — NOT INTERESTED
objection_not_interested.say: Totally get it, Erin. I should've assumed you'd be all set — otherwise you probably would've reached out to us. Just so no one from my team cold calls you again — is it that this just isn't a problem you're focused on right now, or is it more that you hate cold calls? Honestly either one's fair.
objection_not_interested.note: Agree first — surprise her by not pushing back. Then split the objection into two options. Most people will clarify, which reopens the door.

branches.label: Not focused on this / other priorities
I just hate cold calls / bad timing

objection_no_budget.label: OBJECTION — NO BUDGET / NOT NOW
objection_no_budget.say: Totally get it. Nowadays it's hard enough to keep the tools you've got, let alone bring on something new. Just so I'm not wasting your time — is it that budget this cycle is completely locked, or is it more that anything new has to go through a whole approval process with you and Pablo?
objection_no_budget.note: You know Pablo Flores is CEO and co-owner. Referencing him by name shows you understand their decision structure. Split between 'no money' and 'approval process.'

branches.label: Budget is locked / not this quarter
Need to run it by Pablo / partner

objection_have_process.label: OBJECTION — WE HAVE A PROCESS
objection_have_process.say: That makes total sense — with thirty-plus luxury properties you'd have to have something dialed in. Is it that you're fully covered and happy with how it's working, or is it more that switching anything right now during the season would be a headache?
objection_have_process.note: Validate their process. Split between 'happy' and 'switching pain.' If they admit it's not perfect, that's your crack in the door.

branches.label: Switching would be a pain right now

test_drive.label: SELL THE TEST DRIVE
test_drive.say: Totally respect that — you're probably not buying anything right now and I get it. But the operators who end up moving on this stuff are usually the ones who already know what's out there before budget opens up. Would you be open to just taking a look — not to buy anything, just so it's on your radar? Fifteen minutes, and if nothing else you'll see what other companies in the Coachella Valley are doing with turnover photos heading into festival season.
test_drive.note: Last real shot at a meeting. Frame it as intelligence-gathering, not a sales pitch. Mentioning festival season adds urgency without being pushy.

send_email.label: SEND ME AN EMAIL
send_email.say: Totally fair — I'll shoot something over. One quick question so it's not just another generic pitch sitting in your inbox: what would be most useful for me to include? Like is it more about what it costs, how it actually works with Hostaway, or what other operators in the area are seeing?
send_email.note: Always ask what to include. It tells you what she cares about AND re-engages the conversation. Whatever she says, tailor the email to exactly that.

branches.label: Tells you what she wants to see

send_email_end.label: EMAIL WRAP-UP
send_email_end.say: Got it — I'll put something together and get it over to you today. What's the best email — is support at heliosvacations the right one or do you have a direct address? I'll toss a couple time options in there too in case you want to hop on a quick call after you've looked it over. Appreciate your time, Erin.
send_email_end.note: Try to get a direct email instead of the shared support@ inbox. Include two specific time slots in the follow-up. Follow up in 2-3 business days if no response.

referral_pivot.label: REFERRAL — NOT THE RIGHT PERSON
referral_pivot.say: Totally makes sense. Who on your team typically owns the inspection workflow day to day? Is that more Rosana's world or does Marcela handle that on the ops side?
referral_pivot.note: Rosana Castro is Inspections Manager, Marcela De Dios is Operations Manager. Dropping real names shows you're not cold-spraying. Let Erin point you to the right person.

branches.label: I'd still be involved / it's me and Pablo

referral_loop_in.label: REFERRAL — LOOP IN PARTNER
referral_loop_in.say: Makes total sense — you and Pablo would want to look at this together. Would it make more sense to get something on the calendar with both of you? That way nobody's playing telephone.
referral_loop_in.note: Pablo Flores is CEO/co-owner. If she wants him involved, try to book a joint meeting. If she wants to talk to him first, offer to send materials she can forward.

branches.label: Let me talk to him first

referral_get_name.label: GET THE REFERRAL CONTACT
referral_get_name.say: If I can get a direct line or email for them, I'll put something tailored together so it actually lands — instead of going through the general inbox and getting buried.
referral_get_name.note: The only public email is support@heliosvacations.com. A direct number or personal email for Rosana, Marcela, or Pablo would be gold. Write down whatever she gives you.

branches.label: Just call the main line / try support@

referral_end.label: REFERRAL WRAP-UP
referral_end.say: Really appreciate that, Erin. I'll reach out to them and mention you pointed me their way. Thanks for your time — enjoy the rest of your day.
referral_end.note: Use Erin's name as social proof when calling the referral: 'Hey, Erin Tsu mentioned you'd be the right person to talk to about this.' Instantly warms the next call.

gatekeeper.label: GATEKEEPER — SOMEONE ELSE ANSWERS
gatekeeper.say: Hey — could you get me through to Erin? It's Sam.
gatekeeper.note: Bare minimum info. First name only for both you and Erin. Sound like you know her. Don't volunteer anything else yet.

gatekeeper_pushback.label: GATEKEEPER — CONTEXT
gatekeeper_pushback.say: Yeah — I work with a few other vacation rental companies in the Palm Springs area. Would you mind letting her know it's Sam Parks?
gatekeeper_pushback.note: Just enough context to sound legitimate. Don't pitch. Don't say the company name yet. End with a redirect question so you keep control.

branches.label: She's not available / take a message

gatekeeper_social_proof.label: GATEKEEPER — SOCIAL PROOF
gatekeeper_social_proof.say: It's RapidEye — we help a couple other property management companies out here with their inspection workflows. I sent her a note already, would you mind just giving her a heads up that I'm on the line?
gatekeeper_social_proof.note: Third and final attempt. If this doesn't land, ask for a better time to reach Erin directly or take the voicemail.

gatekeeper_voicemail.label: VOICEMAIL / NOT AVAILABLE
gatekeeper_voicemail.say: No worries at all — when's a good time to try her back? ... Got it, thanks so much.
gatekeeper_voicemail.note: Don't leave a voicemail unless you have to. Get a callback time. If forced to leave one: 'Hey Erin, it's Sam Parks — I work with a few vacation rental operators in the valley, give me a shout when you get a sec' plus your number. Under 15 seconds.

ending_graceful.label: GRACEFUL EXIT
ending_graceful.say: Totally understand, Erin. If anything changes or you want to take a look down the road, I'm easy to find. Appreciate your time.
ending_graceful.note: Don't burn the bridge. She may circle back. She may mention you to Pablo or Rosana. Stay warm, stay brief, hang up with class.
